comment: Dr. Loe is a great professor. IT ISN'T EASY. However, if you are willing, this class is all about applying yourself. If you do and put the work in you will grow &develop skills you didn't have. Weekly quizzes/assignments, role plays, out of class sales assignment, and a paper. Be enthusiastic to learn, complete the assignments and you will do fine!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: there is a quiz and discussion post due weekly. end of the year assignment with instructions unclear on how to do. he grades really harshly on assignments where you have to talk about your goals. you have to be specific on discussion posts and if he grades you poorly, all he tells you to do is rewatch the lectures.

Terry Loe makes you do his job as you recruit companies for an event he hosts. He is a conceded man and talks down to students. I am a straight "A" student and I can honestly say that his workload and grading criteria is ridiculous. Very disappointing that Kennesaw has only this outdated professor teaching the capstone sales class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: By far the worst teacher I have taken at KSU. He always talks down to everybody and things he is the best thing to walk this earth. So disappointed that this is the best teacher KSU could get to teach the capstone sales class. If you are about to take him I am very sorry.
This guy thinks that he is the absolute best at everything. Tough grader and makes you do his job for him. Stay away if you can.

I don't usually get on here, but I just want to help others out by just saying AVOID AT ALL COST!! the worst professor I've had in a while, he's not nice he's very rude and I have been taking this class online because of COVID and he's made it miserable. Enough all the positive comments about him they are not true! Please avoid!

Makes you do HIS job for him all semester by recruiting companies for an event HE hosts. Does the same to students each semester and dont forget, youre paying to do this. Gives a shadow assignment during a pandemic and still harshly grades even when getting the information is impossible without lying. Final 2 assignments dictate your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Wouldn't recommend to anyone who thinks this would be a good class for non-major business electives.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Cannot recommend him more! I dreaded taking this class, but he made all the difference for me. He was one of the best profs I've had at KSU. I learned so much from him and wished the class had been longer. Role plays are intimidating at first, but be willing to learn and ask him for feedback. He's a wealth of knowledge and is genuine and caring.
TERRIBLE !!!!

Wonderful professor. He loves his job and wants to provide you with a lot of advice and opportunity. The tests are hard but he gives tons of extra credit. Expects a lot from you, but if you work hard you'll be successful. He is also great for advice and is willing to help students out. Class is mandatory and there's a dress code. Don't buy book

Positive outlook. Very strict. Stated the class was easy, yet his grading says otherwise. Curveball tests. Counts off for late or absents. Teaches only one way to sell. His way or the highway. Doesn't give you a date for role play, you just have a few weeks that you go at random. Have to dress up for almost every class. Picky about attire.

Dr. Loe is my favorite professor I have taken in my long college career. His unique and pragmatic outlook on sales is an incredible recourse for anyone looking for a sales career! He is generous, trustworthy, knowlegable, and honorable. The only barrier to doing well in his class is yourself. If you have the right attitude, Dr. Loe will help you!

Dr. Loe is a great professor and you will learn TONS. Take his class if you are passionate about sales and ready to learn and work hard for your grade. You will be glad you took him because you will be prepared for the “real world”!

He gave me my lowest grade but it was my best class of the semester. In Prof. Loe's class you'll learn more transferable skills than you will in most classes in college. 2 Tests, 4 Role plays and a Final. The first role plays are nerve racking but you have to just jump in the water to learn to swim. The final was the easiest assignment of the class

Dr. Loe gives students a lot of busy work, there is at least one thing due in every class.  He also believes that an 'A' is for students well above excellent.  I am almost a straight 'A' student and I got a 'C'.  Take Dr. Selden or Serkedakis instead if you can!!!

I took him for Advanced Selling. Best decision ever. It is def not an easy class. You will work for your grade but everything we did was applicable and teaches you different aspects of sales. Very helpful. Several assignments but if you do a good job you can probably get a job through the sales contacts, I DID! Not very organized thoughed.
A nice guy but didn't instruct much, seemed like he was doing as little as possible, used others to teach. Waste of time in some classes.

Very interesting guy... very upbeat and positive... great outlook on life... very good teacher, power points help, uses book... tests are a little difficult, have to attend class (but its a class where u dont mind going)...have to do role plays (worst part and still not too bad)... HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!! (and I go for the easy classes)

This is probably one of the best classes I have taken. The class puts what you learn to work. It provides real world training. The written tests are tough but you just have to study the notes. I recommend this class to anyone..

Great teacher.  I learned more in this class than I did in any other class I have ever taken.  DO NOT take this class as an easy elective.  Do take this class if you are interested in going into sales and are willing to put in the work.
